title: What Are LLMs? A Fast Primer
summary: A friendly primer on tokens, attention and why large language models became so powerful.

title: RAG in Practice: When to Use It
summary: Retrieval-Augmented Generation lets models answer with up-to-date, verifiable context. This quick guide shows the core flow.

summary: Handpicked highlights of the week: notable model updates, new dev features and a couple of standout tools.

title: Prompt Engineering: A Mini-Checklist
summary: Keep prompts simple, set role & goal, show one or two examples, and specify outputs. This mini-checklist keeps things consistent.

title: Agents 101: Planning, Tools, Memory
summary: Agents run multi-step plans, call tools and store context. Start with narrow tasks, clear stop criteria and guardrails.

title: When to Fine-Tune vs. Use RAG
summary: Use RAG when knowledge changes often; fine-tune for stable style/format or domain patterns. Many teams combine both.

title: Toolbox: Simple Evaluation for Prompts
summary: A lightweight approach to evaluate prompts with small test sets and pass/fail checks before you ship.

summary: Quick definitions you’ll reference often — straight from the built-in glossary.
